original: Åkerhielm, Nils Samuel, friherre, överstelöjtnant, Göteborg, f. 22/12/88 i Norrköp. av komm :lantmät., frih. Viktor A. o. Ellen Bennich. G. 20 m. Maja Nilsson. A-B Brand-Victorias avd :kont. i Gbg sed. 37. Chef f. ind :hist. avd. v. Gbgsutst. 23, komm. f. Boråsutst. 34, v. ordf. i Dalhems Väv. A-B i Borås, Kgl. Maj :ts om’b. resp. ordf. i Älvsb. skytte-förb. 24-36, v. ordf. i Riksförb. f. ob^mp. kortdist :skjutn. 30, ordf. i dess Boråsavd. 27 o. numera i dess Gbgs- avd., v. ordf. i Sv. sportskytteförb., ordf. i Försäkr :för. f. gen:- o. huvud-ag. RSO, RVO, RDDO, Älvsb. skytte-förib., Riksföi^b. f. olymp, kortdist :-skjutn. o. Sv. Sportskytteförb. ftjGM, SkytteRM m. fl.
translated: Åkerhielm, Nils Samuel, Baron, Lieutenant Colonel, Gothenburg, b. 22/12/88 in Norrköping, son of land surveyor Viktor A. and Ellen Bennich. Married in 1920 to Maja Nilsson. Children: Hans, b. 1921, civil economist, USA, Second Lieutenant in the Army Reserve; Eva, b. 1927, university student in Geneva; Elisabeth, b. 1932, student. Completed secondary school in Linköping in 1908, officer training in 1910, attended the Military College of Karlberg in 1916-1917, Gunnery Inspector Course in 1923-1924. Second Lieutenant in the Älvsborg Regiment in 1910, Lieutenant in 1916, Captain in 1925, Major in the Reserve in 1936, Lieutenant Colonel in the Regular Army Reserve in 1944. Head of the Life Insurance Company AB Thules' general agency in Gothenburg since 1936, Branch Controller of the Insurance Company AB Brand-Victoria in Gothenburg since 1937. Head of the Industrial History Department at the Gothenburg Exhibition in 1923, Commissioner for the Borås Exhibition in 1934, Vice Chairman of Dalhems Väv AB in Borås, Royal Majesty’s Deputy or Chairman of the Älvsborg Shooting Association in 1924-1936, Vice Chairman of the National Association for Disabled Short-Distance Shooting in 1930, Chairman of its Borås branch since 1927 and currently of its Gothenburg branch, Vice Chairman of the Swedish Sports Shooting Association, Chairman of the Insurance Association for General and Principal Agents. Recipient of the Royal Order of the Sword, Royal Victorian Order, Knights of the North Star, Knight of the Order of Vasa, Älvsborg Shooting Association, National Association for Olympic Short-Distance Shooting, and the Swedish Sports Shooting Association Grand Master, Shooting Master, and others.
